summary: Saint Petersburg, Russia's second-largest city, is a historic and cultural center on the Baltic Sea. Founded by Tsar Peter the Great in 1703, it was once the capital of Imperial Russia. The city, known for its beautiful architecture and museums like the Hermitage, is a popular tourist destination. It has a rich history, including being besieged during World War II. Originally named Petrograd, then Leningrad, it reverted to its original name in 1991. Saint Petersburg is also an important economic and scientific hub, often called Russia's "Northern Capital."
title: Saint Petersburg
